src:
Lion Air Nyaris Gagal Mendarat di Tarakan
02 Nov 2019, 23:50 by Bisnis.com, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Dua pesawat milik maskapai Lion Air nyaris tidak dapat mendarat di Bandara Juwata Tarakan Kalimantan Utara akibat cuaca buruk.
Kepala Seksi Operasi Basarnas Kaltim-Kaltara, Octavianto mennyatakan kedua pesawat yang gagal mendarat adalah dengan rute penerbangan Surabaya-Tarakan dan Balikpapan-Tarakan.
Dalam keterangan tertulisnya Octavianto menyebutkan, pesawat Boeing 737-9 GP dengan nomor penerbangan JT768/5739 PK-LHU dari Bandara Balikpapan berangkat pada pukul 18.30 wita.
Sesuai jadwal kedatangannya di Bandara Juwata Tarakan pada pukul 19.35 Wita. Sedangkan pesawat Boeing 737-8 GP dengan nomor penerbangan JT268/8738/PK-LJU dari Surabaya menuju Tarakan berangkat pada pukul 15.10 wita dan jadwal kedatangannya pukul 19.10 wita.
Namun saat akan mendarat kedua pesawat milik Lion Air ini tertunda hingga 30 menit berputar-putar di udara Tarakan. Beberapa jam kemudian kedua pesawat tersebut berhasil mendarat di Bandara Juwata Tarakan.
Octavianto menginformasikan, pesawat Lion Air dari Surabaya dengan nomor penerbangan JT268 sukses mendarat pukul 18.10 wita dan pesawat dari Balikpapan mendarat pukul 20.16 wita. "Semua penumpang selamat, kata Octavianto.
text:
Lion Air Barely Failed to Land in Tarakan
02 Nov 2019, 23:50 by Bisnis.com, Dewi Rina Cahyani
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Two aircraft owned by Lion Air could barely land at Juwata Tarakan Airport in North Kalimantan due to bad weather.
Head of the East Kalimantan Basarnas Basarnas Operations Section, Octavianto said the two planes that failed to land were on the Surabaya-Tarakan and Balikpapan-Tarakan flight routes.
In his written statement Octavianto said, the Boeing 737-9 GP with flight number JT768 / 5739 PK-LHU from Balikpapan Airport departed at 18:30 West Indonesia Time.
According to the schedule of his arrival at Juwata Tarakan Airport at 19:35 Wita. While the Boeing 737-8 GP aircraft with flight number JT268 / 8738 / PK-LJU from Surabaya to Tarakan departs at 3:10 pm and its arrival schedule is at 19.10 pm.
But when they were about to land, these two Lion Air aircraft were delayed for up to 30 minutes circling in Tarakan air. A few hours later the two aircraft successfully landed at Juwata Tarakan Airport.
Octavianto informed that the Lion Air plane from Surabaya with flight number JT268 successfully landed at 18:10 West Indonesia Time and the aircraft from Balikpapan landed at 20.16 West Indonesia Time. "All passengers survived, said Octavianto.
